hillbillies.model

Class Unit

  • java.lang.Object
    • hillbillies.model.Unit

  • public class Unit
extends java.lang.Object
    A class of units with a current position, a name, weight, strength, agility and toughness.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ruben Cartuyvels
    Invariants:
  • the current number of hitpoints must always be greater than or equal to zero and equal to or smaller than the max number of hitpoints.
        currentHitPoints >= 0 && currentHitPoints <= maxHitPoints
  • the current number of stamina points must always be greater than or equal to zero and equal to or smaller than the max number of stamina points.
        currentStaminaPoints >= 0 && currentStaminaPoints <= maxStaminaPoints

    • Constructor Detail

      • Unit

        public Unit(java.lang.String name,
    int[] initialPosition,
    int weight,
    int agility,
    int strength,
    int toughness,
    boolean enableDefaultBehavior)
     throws IllegalPositionException,
            IllegalNameException
        Initialize a new unit with the given attributes.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the unit.
        initialPosition - The initial position of the unit, as an array with 3 elements {x, y, z}.
        weight - The initial weight of the unit
        agility - The initial agility of the unit
        strength - The initial strength of the unit
        toughness - The initial toughness of the unit
        enableDefaultBehavior - Whether the default behavior of the unit is enabled
        Postconditions:
      • the new name of the unit is equal to the given name.
            new.getName() == name
      • the new position of the unit is equal to the given position.
            new.getPosition() == position
      • The new maximum no. of hitpoints and current no. of hitpoints of the unit is equal to 200 times the product of the weight divided by 100 and the toughness divided by 100, rounded up to the next integer.
            new.getMaxHitPoints() = Math.ceil(200*(getWeight()/100.0)*
             (getToughness()/100.0));
      • The new maximum no. of stamina points and current no. of stamina points of the unit is equal to 200 times the product of the weight divided by 100 and the toughness divided by 100, rounded up to the next integer.
            new.getMaxStaminaPoints() = Math.ceil(200*(getWeight()/100.0)*
             (getToughness()/100.0));
      • The new orientation of the unit is equal to Pi/2
            new.getOrientation() = Math.PI/2
        • Throws:
        IllegalPositionException(position, - [CAN] this) The unit cannot have the given position (out of bounds).
            ! canHaveAsPosition(position)
        IllegalNameException(name, - [CAN] this) The unit cannot have the given name.
            ! canHaveAsName(name)
        IllegalPositionException
        IllegalNameException

    • Method Detail

      • convertPositionToDouble

        public double[] convertPositionToDouble(int[] intPosition)
                                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Converts a position given in integers to a position given in double values. This is an auxiliary method.
        Parameters:
        intPosition - The position given in integer values.
        Returns:
        the position provided as parameter converted to the java double primitive type.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - [CAN] The parameter is not an array of integers.
            ! intPosition instanceof int[]
            || intPosition.length != 3

      • convertPositionToInt

        public int[] convertPositionToInt(double[] doublePosition)
                           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Converts a position given in doubles to a position given in integer values. This is an auxiliary method.
        Parameters:
        doublePosition - The position given in double values.
        Returns:
        the position provided as parameter converted to the java integer primitive type.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - [CAN] The parameter is not an array of doubles.
            ! doublePosition instanceof double[]
            || doublePosition.length != 3

      • canHaveAsPosition

        public boolean canHaveAsPosition(double[] position)
        Check whether the given position is a valid position for a unit.
        Parameters:
        position - The position to be checked.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the position is effective, if it consists of an array with 3 double elements, and if each element is between 0.0 and 50.0.
            result = ( (position instanceof double[])
             && (position.length == 3)
             && (for each coordinate in position:
             coordinate > 0.0 && coordinate < 50.0)

      • getCubeCoordinate

        public int[] getCubeCoordinate()
        Return the position of the cube in the game world occupied by the unit.

        public double[] getPosition()
        Return the exact position of the unit in the game world.

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Return the current name of the unit.

      • setName

        public void setName(java.lang.String newName)
             throws IllegalNameException
        Set the name of the unit to the given name.
        Parameters:
        name - The new name for this unit.
        Postcondition:
        The new name of this unit is equal to the given name.
            new.getName() == newName
        Throws:
        IllegalNameException - [CAN] The given position is not valid.
            !canHaveAsName(newName)

      • canHaveAsName

        public boolean canHaveAsName(java.lang.String name)
        Check whether the given name is a valid name for a unit.
        Parameters:
        name - The name to be checked.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the name is effective, if its length is larger than 1, if the first character is an uppercase letter and if it only exists of lowercase or uppercase letters, single or double quotes and spaces.
            result = ( (name != null)
             && (name.length() > 1)
             && (name.matches("[a-zA-Z\\s\'\"]+"))

      • getWeight

        public int getWeight()
        Return the units' weight.

      • setWeight

        public void setWeight(int newValue)
        Set the weight of the unit to the given new value.
        Parameters:
        newValue - The new weight for this unit.
        Postcondition:
        if the given weight is between 1 and 200 (inclusively) and larger than the mean of the strength and the agility of the unit, the new weight of the unit is equal to the given weight.
            if (isInteger(newValue) && newValue > 0
             && newValue < 201 && newValue >= (getStrength()+getAgility())/2)
            then new.getWeight() == newValue

      • getStrength

        public int getStrength()
        Return the units' strength.

      • setStrength

        public void setStrength(int newValue)
        Set the strength of the unit to the given new value.
        Parameters:
        newValue - The new strength for this unit.
        Postcondition:
        if the given strength is between 1 and 200 (inclusively) then the new strength of the unit is equal to the given weight.
            if (isInteger(newValue) && newValue > 0
             && newValue < 201
            then new.getStrength() == newValue

      • getAgility

        public int getAgility()
        Return the units' agility.

      • setAgility

        public void setAgility(int newValue)
        Set the agility of the unit to the given new value.
        Parameters:
        newValue - The new agility for this unit.
        Postcondition:
        if the given agility is between 1 and 200 (inclusively) then the new agility of the unit is equal to the given agility.
            if (isInteger(newValue) && newValue > 0
             && newValue < 201
            then new.getAgility() == newValue

             && newValue < 201
            then new.getToughness() == newValue

      • getMaxHitPoints

        public int getMaxHitPoints()
        Return the units' maximum number of hitpoints.

      • updateMaxHitPoints

        public void updateMaxHitPoints()
        Update the maximum number of hitpoints of the unit.
        Postcondition:
        The new maximum no. of hitpoints of the unit is equal to 200 times the product of the weight divided by 100 and the toughness divided by 100, rounded up to the next integer.
            new.getMaxHitPoints() = Math.ceil(200*(getWeight()/100.0)*
             (getToughness()/100.0));

      • getCurrentHitPoints

        public int getCurrentHitPoints()
        Return the units' current number of hitpoints.

      • updateCurrentHitPoints

        public void updateCurrentHitPoints(int newValue)
        Update the current number of hitpoints of the unit.
        Parameters:
        newValue - The new value for the current no. of hitpoints of the unit.
        Precondition:
        the given new value must be larger than or equal to zero and less than or equal to the max no. of hitpoints
            newValue >= 0 && newValue <= getMaxHitPoints()
        Postcondition:
        The new no. of hitpoints of the unit is equal to the given new value.

      • getMaxStaminaPoints

        public int getMaxStaminaPoints()

      • updateMaxStaminaPoints

        public void updateMaxStaminaPoints()
        Update the maximum number of stamina points of the unit.
        Postcondition:
        The new maximum no. of stamina points of the unit is equal to 200 times the product of the weight divided by 100 and the toughness divided by 100, rounded up to the next integer.
            new.getMaxStaminaPoints() = Math.ceil(200*(getWeight()/100.0)*
             (getToughness()/100.0));

      • getCurrentStaminaPoints

      • updateCurrentStaminaPoints

        public void updateCurrentStaminaPoints(int newValue)
        Update the current number of stamina points of the unit.
        Parameters:
        newValue - The new value for the current no. of stamina points of the unit.
        Precondition:
        the given new value must be larger than or equal to zero and less than or equal to the max no. of stamina points
            newValue >= 0 && newValue <= getMaxStaminaPoints()
        Postcondition:
        The new no. of stamina points of the unit is equal to the given new value.
